questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You plan to have Teams administrators use self-help diagnostics.

Which two scenarios are covered by self-help diagnostics? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD

choices.D: Validate that a specified user is configured to record meetings.
choices.A: Attempt to locate a missing Teams meeting recording.
choices.E: Validate end-to-end encryption for strictly confidential Teams meetings
choices.C: Validate that a specified user can disable Teams live events.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Host1, Host2, and Host3 only
Teams VDI is supported on Windows-based VDI solutions, but not on Linux.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

You have a virtualized desktop infrastructure (VDI) that contains the virtual machines shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to install the Teams for VDI client on supported virtual machines.

Which virtual machines support the Teams for VDI client?

choices.A: From PowerShell, run the Start-CsExMeetingMigration cmdlet and specify the -identity parameter.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the Microsoft Teams upgrade policy.
choices.B: Run the Skype for Business Meeting Migration tool.
choices.D: From PowerShell, run the Set-CsTeamsUpgradeConfiguration cmdlet.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the meeting policy.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You recently set the company's Microsoft Teams upgrade policy to Teams only coexistence mode.
A user reports that several online meetings are configured to use Microsoft Skype for Business.
You need to convert the online meetings in the user's calendar to use Microsoft Teams.
What are two possible ways to achieve the goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content: Agreed! Taking a look at those two provided links confirms that.
AE is correct. I agree with you

The PowerShell in A is correct for sure and it took me a while to find that second setting, but I found it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GdGqyS72cn8&feature=emb_logo
Users > user > account > Teams upgrade > edit > Migrate this user's meetings to Teams set to ON.

discussion.content:
AE is correct. There are 4 ways to trigger the Meeting Migration Service. these are items 3 and 4 from the list at this link:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/audio-conferencing-in-office-365/setting-up-the-meeting-migration-service-mms

B is NOT correct. This tool updates SfB meetings with new links etc, but has nothing to do with migrating to Teams. 
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/meeting-update-tool-for-skype-for-business-and-lync-2b525fe6-ed0f-4331-b533-c31546fcf4d4

comments.content:
It isn't B. "The Meeting Update Tool for Skype for Business and Lync helps you update your meetings when your account switches servers or when it upgrades from Lync to Skype for Business."

It doesn't update SfB meetings to Teams meetings. This info is from: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/meeting-update-tool-for-skype-for-business-and-lync-2b525fe6-ed0f-4331-b533-c31546fcf4d4

Correct answers are A and E.

discussion.content:
AB
A: Meeting Migration Service (MMS) is a Skype for Business service that runs in the background and automatically updates Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams meetings for users. MMS is designed to eliminate the need for users to run the Meeting Migration Tool to update their Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams meetings. Also, with Start-CsExMeetingMigration cmdlet, you can start a meeting migration manually.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/audio-conferencing-in-office-365/setting-up-the-meeting-migration-service-mms
B: The Skype for Business Online, Meeting Update Tool helps you to update all of your existing meetings after you are enabled for PSTN Conferencing in Skype for Business Online. This tool finds your existing meetings with outdated information and automatically sends updated meeting invitations to all the participants. After the tool is run, your meetings will reflect the new information that should be used by you and your participants to join it. The tool will update the Conference URL of the meeting as the phone number and conference ID that can be used to join it via PSTN Conferencing.

Selected Answer: AB
I think A & B is he correct ans as Microsoft Teams upgrade policy(which is now called Teams update management settings) contains -
 
Show Teams preview features 
Update policies are used to manage Teams and Office Preview users who will see pre-release or preview features in the Teams app.

Use new Teams client
Classic team default version or new team default version.

Only Microsoft Teams upgrade settings can be used to upgrade skype to teams
https://techieberry.com/migrate-skype-meetings-to-teams/

AB is correct. In the link reference clearly explains how the migration tool works and it explains how it convert skype meetings into Teams meetings. According to the question, user is already in Teams Only, so the upgrade option has been changed and the user still has the issue. A and B are the options to fix the issue.

Selected Answer: AE
A and E are correct
A - Start-CsExMeetingMigration cmdlet and specify the -identity parameter. Ref # https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/start-csexmeetingmigration?view=skype-ps 
Excerpts from article - MMS is designed to eliminate the need for users to run the Meeting Migration Tool to update their Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams meetings. "So this automatically kicks out option B"
E - Modify the Microsoft Teams upgrade policy. While modifying only you get the option to migrate meetings to Teams. This triggers MMS and takes few hours to update meetings. This also sends new meeting notifications to the recipients with Teams link.

Selected Answer: AE
AE is correct.

Selected Answer: AE
The Meeting Migration Service (MMS) is a service that updates a user’s existing meetings in the following scenarios:
- When a user is migrated from on-premises to the cloud.
- When an admin makes a change to the user’s audio conferencing settings
- When an online user is upgraded to Teams only, or when a user's mode in TeamsUpgradePolicy is set to SfBwithTeamsCollabAndMeetings
- When you use PowerShell
By default, MMS is automatically triggered in each of these cases. In addition, admins can use a PowerShell cmdlet to manually trigger meeting migration for a given user.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/audio-conferencing-in-office-365/setting-up-the-meeting-migration-service-mms

Selected Answer: AE
A and E are the correct answer, B is not correct

I believe AE are correct

AE is correct.

I doubt Microsoft will ask this question worded the way this one is, answer B is simply too incorrect.

This is the important factor: Meeting migration is only invoked when you grant TeamsUpgradePolicy for a specific user. If you grant TeamsUpgradePolicy with mode=TeamsOnly or mode=SfBWithTeamsCollabAndMeetings on a tenant-wide basis, meeting migration is not invoked.

The Meeting Migration Service (MMS) is a service that updates a user’s existing meetings in the following scenarios:
- When a user is migrated from on-premises to the cloud (whether to Skype for Business Online or to TeamsOnly).
- When an online user is upgraded to Teams only, or when a user's mode in TeamsUpgradePolicy is set to SfBwithTeamsCollabAndMeetings


Limitations: The meeting migration service can't be used if any of the following apply: In these situations, end users can use the Meeting Migration Tool to migrate their own meetings instead.

The user’s mailbox is hosted in Exchange on-premises.
The user is being migrated from the cloud to Skype for Business Server on-premises.

A is clear for me and the second option must be E according to:

By default, when assigning either TeamsOnly or SfbWithTeamsCollabAndMeetings to an individual user, any existing Skype for Business meetings scheduled by that user for the future are converted to Teams meetings. If desired, you can leave these meetings as Skype for Business meetings either by specifying -MigrateMeetingsToTeams $false when granting TeamsUpgradePolicy, or by unselecting the checkbox in the Teams Admin portal. The ability to convert meetings from Skype for Business to Teams is not available when granting TeamsUpgradePolicy on a tenant-wide basis.
Answer is: A & E

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
The company has the departments and teams shown in the following table.
//IMG//

You need to ensure that only the following apps appear in the app bar of the Microsoft Teams client for only the events department:
✑ Activity
✑ Shifts
✑ Chat
What should you do first?

discussion.content:
This is correct answer.
Sahee hai.
On the test Nov, 12 2021

Correct answer is C
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-app-setup-policies#assign-a-custom-app-setup-policy-to-users

Selected Answer: C
correct answer is C
why not D?

comments.content: Updating the default policy would affect all 3 teams, whereas the question states that it wants the apps pinned for only the "Events" team. You would need to make a new policy and then assign it to the team, so C is the correct answer.

discussion.content: C. Teams admin center > Teams apps . Setup policies > Add > etc.

App setup policy: 
Pin apps - lets you choose apps to pin for your users, 
Install apps - You can choose which apps are installed by default for users in their personal Teams environment
upload customs - you allow users to upload custom apps to Teams.

Tip: take time and understand between Teams-wide permissions and policies difference, I felt like MS personally want to harass me with naming just for exam sake, few names makes perfect sense and few are just gutter.

Correct answer - Teams app setup policies
Teams app setup policies (to control the default apps available to users) and Teams app permission policies (to control the apps users are allowed to install)
I assume it's C custom app setup policy because you're setting up the app for only 1 channel/group and setting it up not modifying an existing one nor doing it globally.

choices.A: Create a custom app permission policy.
choices.C: Create a custom app setup policy.
choices.D: Modify the global app setup policy.
choices.B: Modify the global app permission policy.
Skype for Business with Teams collaboration

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
You plan to upgrade from Microsoft Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams.
You use the following workloads in Skype for Business:
✑ Audio/video conferencing
✑ Dial-in conferencing
✑ Enterprise Voice
✑ Persistent Chat
✑ Chat
You need to ensure that users can evaluate Microsoft Teams while maintaining PSTN calling by using the Skype for Business client.
Which coexistence mode should you use?

discussion.content:
A. Why? You need to ensure that users can evaluate Microsoft Teams = FULL set of features that Teams normally offer. Islands allow for both clients to work independently as well as retain PSTN calls in SfB:
"To avoid a confusing or regressed Skype for Business experience, the Skype for Business handles the following integrations that aren't handled in Teams Islands mode:

External (federated) communications.
PSTN voice services and voice applications, Office integration.
HID controls for USB devices.
Several other integrations."

The answer is D, please note that coexistence mode "Meeting first" is also know as S4BWithTeamsCollaborationAndMeetings, in this mode, users will use Teams to schedule and conduct their meetings. Private chat and calling remain on Skype for Business. this is what the question is about, to retain PSTN functionality within S4B.

comments.content: You are correct. I believe they are looking for this answer, they are only conserned about the PSTN functionality which is what Meeting First (S4BWithTeamsCollaborationAndMeetings) gives you

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct: Doc says "if you have significant Skype for Business Server on-premises assets with a complex Enterprise Voice deployment, but want your users to enjoy modern meetings as quickly as possible, you might want to evaluate using the Skype for Business with Teams Collaboration and Meetings mode, also known as Meetings First." which is S4BWithTeamsCollaborationAndMeetings,

A - Default configuration for hybrid organizations. Allows a single user to evaluate both clients side by side. Chats and calls can land in either client, so users must always run both clients. To avoid a confusing or regressed Skype for Business experience, external (federated) communications, PSTN voice services and voice applications, Office integration, and several other integrations continue to be handled by Skype for Business.

Selected Answer: B
"If you want to evaluate Microsoft Teams while maintaining PSTN calling by using the Skype for Business client, you should use the "Skype for Business with Teams Collaboration" coexistence mode. This mode allows users to use both Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams simultaneously, and provides interoperability between the two platforms. " ChatGPT
correct answer is D, Meetings First is an alternative to using Islands mode that prioritizes the Teams meetings experience

Selected Answer: A
Islands mode allow user to use Telephony on Sfb while using Teams

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
